thread.title: IMF Says China’s Yuan Isn’t Undervalued, Despite Decline
thread.title_full: IMF Says China’s Yuan Isn’t Undervalued, Despite Decline - WSJ

author: Mark Magnier
title: IMF Says China’s Yuan Isn’t Undervalued, Despite Decline
text:
BEIJING—China’s currency isn’t undervalued despite last week’s decline against the U.S. dollar, but the world’s second-largest economy still needs to adopt a fully market-based exchange-rate system within three years, the International Monetary Fund said Friday.
Last week, China introduced changes to make trading in the yuan more market driven. Economists and currency traders said it is an improvement over the previous system since opening rates are more explicitly linked to the prior day’s closing level. But the system...
